column4: MADE IT!  Gah people ask like linux is a breeze these days.  I will say it is 10000x better then before.
can you install Adobe Air using Apt-get or synaptic?  I can't find the package.  Am I missing a repository?
really?  I FF/RW in VLC frquently
How?  I want to drag a slider, not use ctrl+forward
fullscreen or windowed?
when fullscreen, I get a draggable 'progress bar' for a video onscreen.  When windowed, there's one in the main VLC window.
Even on embedded wmp videos in Firefox?
AH, that's the part I missed.  I don't watch a lot of embedded media
try ~/Desktop/AdobeAirInstaller.bin
I believe so..  what hhp2k1 said :)
/op1 or /opt?
let me copy and paste, tiny weird font
/opt
/opt is.. infrequently used, but it's not unheard of.
where are apps normally /bin or something?
usr/bin maybe?
most things end up under /usr or /usr/local, some some use /opt  (optional software) as some older UNIX systems didn't have /usr/local
it's a legacy thing
alt-shift-arrow
correctuon- ctrl-alt-shift-arrow
there it goes :)
look into ufw and gufw
